data.name: Egg Dropping Puzzle (2 eggs only)
data.description:
# Egg Dropping Puzzle (2 eggs only)

## The task:
Your task is to find the lowest floor, from which a dropped egg will break.

## You can assume:
* An egg will break if previous one broke from a lower floor.
* An egg will not break if previous one ddidn't break from a higher floor.
* The floors are indexed from `0` to `numberOfFloors - 1`.
* You are always given exactly 2 eggs at the start.

## Requirements
Your solution needs to meet all 3 requirements:
* The returned value needs to be the searcher for floor.
* The number of eggs at the end needs to be higher or equal to 0.
* The number of guesses can't exeed the maximum (based on the number of floors).

## You are given getters for:
* `numberOfFloors`: the number of floors.
* `eggs`: the number of eggs left (can go negative, but won't make the test).
* `guesses`: array of your previous guesses.
* `lastBroke`: if the last dropped egg broke.

## How to drop an egg?
For this purpose, there is the`dropFrom` method. This method will return `true` if the input given is the index of the searched-for floor. Otherwise, the returned value is `false`. This method will also update the getters accordingly.

## Example:
```js
function solve(puzzle) {
  for (let i = 0; i < puzzle.numberOfFloors; i++) {
    if (puzzle.dropFrom(i)) return i;
  }
}
```
This code will try all floors one by one starting from 0. It will return the right answer, but the number of guesses will be too high.

## Links:

More info about the problem on [wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dynamic_programming#Egg_dropping_puzzle) and [brilliant](https://brilliant.org/wiki/egg-dropping/).  
Similar kata: [FabergÃ© Easter Eggs crush test (3 kyu)](https://www.codewars.com/kata/54cb771c9b30e8b5250011d4)
